Single Cell Schemas

Study ID Required
Name study_id
Description A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study
Example A7F9B3X2
Regex ^[a-zA-Z0-9]+$
First Name Required
Name contact_first_name
Description Given first name
Example Jane
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C40974
Regex ^[a-zA-Z]+$
Last Name Required
Name contact_last_name
Description Given last name.
Example Doe
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C40975
Regex ^[a-zA-Z]+$
Email Required
Name contact_email
Description Valid email address
Example janedoe@example.com
Regex ^[\w-\.]+@([\w-]+\.)+[\w-]{2,4}$
Workflow
Name workflow
Description The workflow or protocol followed during the study.
Example spatial_transcriptomics
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Allowed Values Microfluidics, Facs, Sequencing Microfluidics, Facs, Culturing Microfluidics, Facs, Culturing, Sequencing Spatial transcriptomics Laser microdissection Laser microdissection, Culturing Laser microdissection, Culturing, Sequencing Laser microdissection, Sequencing
Sample ID Required
Name sample_id
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the study.
Example study123
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Organism
Name organism
Description The full scientific name of the species studied.
Example Arenicola marina
Regex ^[A-Za-z]+[a-z]+$
Strain
Name strain
Description An identifier of the strain of the organism, if applicable.
Example CCAP1119/17
Reference http://www.ebi.ac.uk/efo/EFO_0005135
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Tissue
Name tissue
Description The type of tissue sampled for the study.
Example Leaf
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C19697
Allowed Values Abdomen Anterior Body Blade Blood Bodywall Bract Brain Bud Cap Cephalothorax Dna Extract Egg Eggshell Endocrine Tissue Eye Fat Body Fin Flower Gill Animal Gill Fungi Gonad Hair Head Heart Hepatopancreas Holdfast Fungi Intestine Kidney Leaf Leg Liver Lung Mid Body Modular Colony Mollusc Foot Multicellular Organisms In Culture Muscle Mycelium Mycorrhiza Ovary Animal Oviduct Pancreas Petiole Posterior Body Root Scales Scat Seed Seedling Shoot Skin Sperm Seminal Fluid Spleen Spore Bearing Structure Spore Stem Stipe Stomach Tentacle Terminal Body Testis Thallus Fungi Thallus Plant Thorax Unicellular Organisms In Culture Whole Organism Whole Plant Other Fungal Tissue Other Plant Tissue Other Reproductive Animal Tissue Other Somatic Animal Tissue Not Applicable Not Collected Not Provided
Imaging Protocol ID Required
Name imaging_protocol_id
Description A unique alphanumeric identifier for the imaging protocol.
Example img123
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Platform Required
Name platform
Description The platform used to isolate the cells.
Example Illumina NovaSeq
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Instrument Required
Name instrument
Description The instrument used to isolate the cells.
Example Illumina NovaSeq 6000
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Dissociation Method
Name dissociation_method
Description The method used for dissociating the cells.
Example enzymatic
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Allowed Values Enzymatic
Dissociation Time
Name dissociation_time
Description The time duration for dissociation in minutes.
Example 30
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Dissociation Temperature
Name dissociation_temperature
Description The temperature at which dissociation is performed in degrees celsius.
Example 37
Regex ^-?\d+(\.\d+)?$
Dissociation Enzyme
Name dissociation_enzyme
Description The enzyme used for dissociation.
Example collagenase
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Allowed Values Collagenase
Dissociation Enzyme Concentration
Name dissociation_enzyme_concentration
Description The concentration of the dissociation enzyme.
Example 0.25
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Material Incubation Temperature
Name material_incubation_temperature
Description The temperature at which the material is incubated in degrees C.
Example 37
Regex ^-?\d+(\.\d+)?$
Material Incubation Time
Name material_incubation_time
Description The time duration for material incubation in hours.
Example 30
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Lysis Buffer Solution
Name lysis_buffer_solution
Description The solution used for lysis buffer.
Example RIPA buffe
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Target Probes Required
Name target_probes
Description The type of probes used to detect and quantify specific RNA molecules in their native spatial context within a tissue or cell.
Example Oligo-dT
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Section Thickness Μm
Name section_thickness_µm
Description The thickness of the tissue section in micrometres.
Example 10
Regex ^\d+(\.\d+)?$
Section Thickness Method
Name section_thickness_method
Description The method used to measure tissue section thickness.
Example Microtome
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Section Thickness Temperature
Name section_thickness_temperature
Description The temperature at which the section was made.
Example Room temperature
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Is Pathological
Name is_pathological
Description A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being abnormal and having a destructive effect on living tissue.
Example No
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Digestion Workflow
Name digestion_workflow
Description A link to a workflow describing the digestion protocol in Protocols.io
Example Spatial transcriptomics dissociation
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Digestion Time In Minutes
Name digestion_time_in_minutes
Description The duration of digestion in minutes.
Example 45
Regex ^\d+$
Digestion Temperature
Name digestion_temperature
Description The temperature at which digestion was carried out.
Example 37
Regex ^-?\d+(\.\d+)?$
Photobleaching Duration In Hours
Name photobleaching_duration_in_hours
Description The duration of photobleaching in hours
Example 2
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Instrument User Guide Required
Name instrument_user_guide
Description The user guide for the instrument used.
Example User Guide v1.2
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Instrument User Guide Revision Required
Name instrument_user_guide_revision
Description The revision of the instrument user guide.
Example 1.2
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Sample Preparation Guide Required
Name sample_preparation_guide
Description The guide used for sample preparation.
Example preparation_guide_v1.0.pdf
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Sample Preparation Guide Revision Required
Name sample_preparation_guide_revision
Description The revision of the sample preparation guide.
Example 1.0
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Deviations From Official Protocol Required
Name deviations_from_official_protocol
Description Any deviations from the official protocol. Separate individual deviations with '|'.
Example Temperature exceeded 25°C during storage | Sample handling delayed by 2 hours
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Library Preparation ID Required
Name library_prep_id
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.
Example libPrep123
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Cell Suspension ID Required
Name cell_suspension_id
Description A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the library preparation.
Example cellSusp123
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Library Preparation Kit Version Required
Name library_prep_kit_version
Description The version number of the library preparation kit used for sequencing.
Example 2
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Amplification Method Required
Name amplification_method
Description The method used to amplify the Complementary DNA (cDNA).
Example PCR
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
cDNA Amplification Cycles Required
Name cDNA_amplification_cycles
Description The number of cycles used during the Complementary DNA (cDNA) amplification process.
Example 12
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Average Size Distribution
Name average_size_distribution
Description The average length of RNA fragments in base pairs (BP) after library preparation, indicating the quality and suitability of the RNA for sequencing.
Example 350
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Library Construction Method
Name library_construction_method
Description The library construction method (including version) that was used.
Example Smart-Seq2
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Input Molecule
Name input_molecule
Description The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from which the sequencing library is derived.
Example RNA
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Primer
Name primer
Description The type of primer used for reverse transcription. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input for mRNA.
Example Random
Allowed Values Oligo-dT Random
Primeness Required
Name primeness
Description The end from which the molecule was sequenced.
Example 5'
Allowed Values 3' 5' Both
End Bias
Name end_bias
Description The end bias of the library.
Example 3
Allowed Values 3 5
Library Strand
Name library_strand
Description The Complementary DNA (cDNA) strand of the library from which the reads derived from - sense (first), antisense (second), both or none.
Example Antisense
Allowed Values Antisense Both Sense Unstranded
Spike In Required
Name spike_in
Description External RNA added to the sample as a control to assess technical variability and normalization in RNA-sequencing. State whether spike-in was used.
Example Yes
Allowed Values Yes No
Spike In Dilution Or Concentration
Name spike_in_dilution_or_concentration
Description The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix.
Example 1:1000
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Sequencing Reference Required
Name sequencing_reference
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.
Example seq123
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Technical Replicate Group Or Library Reference
Name technical_replicate_group_or_library_reference
Description A common term for all runs or files belonging to the same cell or library. It is recommended to use a stable sample accession from a biosample archive like BioSample. Alternatively, the library ID can be referenced from which the files were generated.
Example lib1
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Sequencing Platform Name
Name sequencing_platform_name
Description The name of the sequencing platform used for the experiment.
Example Paired-end
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Sequencing Instrument Model
Name sequencing_instrument_model
Description This refers to the specific machine or platform used to carry out the sequencing process. Different models can have varying throughput, read lengths, error rates, and application suitability.
Example Illumina NovaSeq 6000
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Library Layout Required
Name library_layout
Description The type of library layout used for sequencing.
Example single
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C150423
Allowed Values Single Paired
Reads Per Sample
Name reads_per_sample
Description The number of sequencing reads generated per sample.
Example 1000000
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Umi Barcode Read
Name UMI_barcode_read
Description The type of read that contains the UMI barcode:
Example index2
Allowed Values index1 index2 read1 read2
Umi Barcode Offset
Name UMI_barcode_offset
Description The offset in sequence of the UUnique Molecular Identifier (UMI)MI identifying barcode.
Example 16
Regex ^\d+$
Umi Barcode Size
Name UMI_barcode_size
Description The size of the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) identifying barcode.
Example 10
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Cell Barcode Read
Name cell_barcode_read
Description The type of read that contains the UMI barcode.
Example index1
Allowed Values index1 index2 read1 read2
Cell Barcode Offset
Name cell_barcode_offset
Description The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode. E.g. "0".
Example 10
Regex ^\d+$
Cell Barcode Size
Name cell_barcode_size
Description The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode. E.g. "0".
Example 0
Regex ^\d+$
Cdna Read
Name cDNA_read
Description The type of read that contains the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read.
Example read1
Allowed Values index1 index2 read1 read2
Cdna Read Offset
Name cDNA_read_offset
Description The type of read that contains the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read.
Example 5
Allowed Values index1 index2 read1 read2
Cdna Read Size
Name cDNA_read_size
Description The size of the cDNA read. E.g. "100".
Example 75
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Sample Barcode Read
Name sample_barcode_read
Description The type of read that contains the sample barcode.
Example read2
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Allowed Values index1 index2 read1 read2
Sample Barcode Offset
Name sample_barcode_offset
Description The offset in sequence of the sample identifying barcode.
Example 30
Regex ^\d+$
Sample Barcode Size
Name sample_barcode_size
Description The size of the read that contains the sample barcode.
Example 8
Regex ^\d+$
Imaging Protocol ID Required
Name imaging_protocol_id
Description A unique alphanumeric identifier for the imaging protocol.
Example img123
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Library Preparation ID Required
Name library_preparation_id
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.
Example libPrep123
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Sequencing ID Required
Name sequencing_id
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.
Example seq123
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Read 1 File Required
Name read_1_file
Description The name of the file that contains read 1.
Example file1_r1.fastq.gz
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Read 2 File Required
Name read_2_file
Description The name of the file that contains read 2.
Example file2_r2.fastq.gz
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Index 1 File Required
Name index_1_file
Description The name of the file that contains index 1.
Example file1_i1.fastq.gz
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Index 2 File Required
Name index_2_file
Description The name of the file that contains index 2.
Example file2_i2.fastq.gz
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Read Checksum Required
Name read_checksum
Description Result of a hash function calculated on the content of both the read 1 file and the read 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).
Example d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e,5a105e8b9d40e1329780d62ea2265d8a77a1a45e
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Index Checksum Required
Name index_checksum
Description Result of a hash function calculated on the content of both the index 1 file and the index 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).
Example d3486ae9136e7856bc42212385ea797094475802,b7e23ec29af22b0b4e41da31e868d57226121c84
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
White List Barcode File
Name white_list_barcode_file
Description A file containing the known cell barcodes in the dataset.
Example barcodes.tsv
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
File Derived From
Name file_derived_from
Description The name of the file that was used to generate the analysis derived data.
Example file1_sequencing.json
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Inferred Cell Type
Name inferred_cell_type
Description Post analysis cell type or identity declaration based on expression profile or known gene function identified by the performer.
Example type II bipolar neuron
Regex ^[A-Za-z]*[a-z]+$
Post Analysis Cell Well Quality
Name post_analysis_cell_well_quality
Description Performer defined measure of whether the read output from the cell was included in the sequencing analysis. For example, cells might be excluded if a threshold percentage of reads did not map to the genome or if pre-sequencing quality measures were not passed.
Example Passed
Allowed Values Pass Fail
Other Derived Cell Attributes
Name other_derived_cell_attributes
Description Any other cell level measurement or annotation as result of the analysis.
Example cluster
Allowed Values Cluster Gene Count UMI Count tSNE coordinates
